intro: Phyllospadix scouleri, commonly known as the Pacific sea holly, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of the Pacific Northwest. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbel-like inflorescences. The plant typically grows in brackish or saltwater environments, often found in tidal zones and estuaries. Its leaves are feather-like and highly divided, while its flowers are small and white, arranged in clusters. Phyllospadix scouleri plays a role in stabilizing coastal soils and provides habitat for various marine and terrestrial organisms.
